titles.title: Identity Theft Improvement Act of 2010
To amend title 18, United States Code, to change the state of mind requirement for certain identity theft offenses, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

bill.summary: 5/26/2010--Introduced. Identity Theft Improvement Act of 2010 - Amends the federal criminal code to eliminate the requirement in a prosecution for identity theft that the prosecution must prove that the defendant knew that the stolen identification documents belonged to another person.
